title: Keir Starmer needs to offer Scottish voters positive action for power
description: Sir Keir Starmer’s message was clear – change is needed and only his party can deliver it. But the UK Labour leader will need to offer Scottish voters something positive to cling onto ahead of polling day if his party’s former red heartland is to help him grab hold of the keys to Downing Street.

title: Labour leader Keir Starmer demands 'ceasefire that lasts' in Gaza
description: Sir Keir Starmer has called for “a ceasefire that lasts” in Gaza amid growing pressure for Labour to support an immediate end to the fighting.

title: Tories could still win next election, Starmer warns in Glasgow speech
description: Keir Starmer has warned the Tories could still win the next UK general election – despite the party consistently polling around 20 points ahead of their rivals. Speaking to Scottish Labour members on the last day of the party’s conference in Glasgow, the Labour leader took aim at the SNP for claiming Labour is almost certain to win the next ballot.

title: Sir Keir Starmer calls for a 'ceasefire that lasts' in Gaza as he rallies Scottish voters

title: David Lammy says sorry for Labour's handling of Rochdale candidate row
description: David Lammy has said he is "sorry" for Labour's initial decision to back its Rochdale candidate after his comments on Israel first came to light. Labour stood by Azhar Ali at first, after he claimed Israel allowed Hamas' attacks as a pretext to invade Gaza.

title: Labour does not rule out supporting motion on Gaza ceasefire
description: Sir Keir Starmer has declared that “fighting must stop now” in Gaza, as Labour declined to rule out shifting its position on the Israel-Hamas war to back an “immediate” ceasefire in a House of Commons vote next week.

title: Starmer calls for a Gaza ‘ceasefire that lasts’ and ‘must happen now’
description: Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer has called for a “ceasefire that lasts” in Gaza, insisting that it “must happen now”. In Glasgow for Scottish Labour’s conference, the party leader has come under fresh pressure for his stance on the crisis after members north of the border backed immediate calls for a ceasefire.

title: Labour ‘can’t stop fighting for a second’ ahead of general election – Starmer
description: The Labour leader warned his party that the ‘volatile’ nature of politics means the Tories could still win another term in power.

title: UK hints at fresh sanctions after Navalny’s death in Russia
description: The UK could launch fresh sanctions against Russia after the death of Russian dissident Alexei Navalny, the foreign secretary has hinted.

title: Are the left and the Palestine movement awash with antisemitism?
description: It is that Israel equals all Jews. So if you criticise Israel, then you are antisemitic. And because the left is more likely to be pro-Palestinian and against what Israel does, then to be left wing is also antisemitic.

title: Labour faces fresh divisions over Gaza as SNP bring new ceasefire vote
description: Labour faces fresh divisions over the Israel-Gaza conflict as a second vote on calling for a ceasefire is set to take place this week.

title: Sir Keir Starmer says North Sea oil and gas will continue ‘for decades to come’ during Scottish Labour Party speech
description: Sir Keir Starmer has insisted work in the North Sea oil and gas sector will continue “for decades to come” as his party continues to face criticism from the industry. It came as the UK Labour leader made a direct appeal to Scots who “have found a new political home with the SNP” to return to his party.

title: How Gordon Brown ruined retirement for a generation

title: Neil Kinnock: Labour leader who lost 'unlosable' election predicts Starmer will end up in No 10
description: Neil Kinnock: Labour leader who lost 'unlosable' election predicts Starmer will end up in No 10 Former Labour leader Neil Kinnock has predicted a victory for Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer at the next election. But he said the UK's voting system made it too difficult to predict if this could mean a majority, despite polls in Labour's facour.

title: Keir Starmer Says Fighting In Gaza 'Must Stop Now' And Rafah Offensive 'Cannot Happen'
description: Keir Starmer has said said the fighting in Gaza “must stop now” and told Israel not to launch an offensive in the city of Rafah. Speaking to the Labour Party’s Scottish conference on Sunday, Starmer called for a “ceasefire that lasts”.

title: Labour seeking SNP deal to avoid new Gaza ceasefire rebellion
description: Party hopes for compromise wording after previous SNP motion saw 56 MPs defy Keir Starmer Labour is hoping to defuse a fresh crisis over Keir Starmer’s cautious stance on Gaza by rewording a Scottish National party motion calling for an immediate ceasefire.

title: Starmer nearly quit after Hartlepool by-election defeat, says new biography

title: Tory Party under Boris Johnson could regain votes of ‘lost Conservatives’
description: Among the “lost Conservatives”, who said they won’t vote Tory at the next election but don’t know who to vote for, 52 per cent said they would vote for Mr Johnson over Sir Keir. This is compared to 39 per cent saying they would vote for the current Prime Minister over the Labour leader.

title: War or peace: decison-time for Starmer
description: DECISION-TIME looms for Sir Keir Starmer as Scottish Labour united at the weekend to call for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza.
